pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [bfe0822f95](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19067/commits/bfe0822f950492eeed266904e2a46e777c5d5726)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Kaehler.JacobiZariski` (new file)|1383|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Cotangent.exact`
`+ Cotangent.map_ofComp_ker`
`+ Cotangent.surjective_map_ofComp`
`+ CotangentSpace.compEquiv`
`+ CotangentSpace.compEquiv_symm_inr`
`+ CotangentSpace.compEquiv_symm_zero`
`+ CotangentSpace.exact`
`+ CotangentSpace.fst_compEquiv`
`+ CotangentSpace.fst_compEquiv_apply`
`+ CotangentSpace.map_ofComp_surjective`
`+ CotangentSpace.map_toComp_injective`
`+ H1Cotangent.exact_map_δ'`
`+ H1Cotangent.exact_δ_map`
`+ H1Cotangent.exact_δ_mapBaseChange`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_C`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_X`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_monomial`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_mul`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_ofComp`
`+ H1Cotangent.δAux_toAlgHom`
`+ H1Cotangent.δ_comp_equiv`
`+ H1Cotangent.δ_eq`
`+ H1Cotangent.δ_eq_δ`
`+ H1Cotangent.δ_eq_δAux`
`+ H1Cotangent.δ_map`
`+ kerCompPreimage`
`+ map_toComp_ker`
`+ ofComp_kerCompPreimage`
`+ ofComp_toAlgHom_monomial_sumElim`
`+ prod_sumElim`
`+ toComp_toAlgHom`
`+ toKaehler_cotangentSpaceBasis`
`++ H1Cotangent.exact_map_δ`
`++ H1Cotangent.δ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.29, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|5034|-1|porting notes|
|1554|2|erw|

Current commit [bfe0822f95](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/bfe0822f950492eeed266904e2a46e777c5d5726)
Reference commit [5ad34c0334](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/5ad34c033417c6e6efd3fcd9062fa1764d240209)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Unfortunately this PR is quite big but it is mainly boring calculation with little interesting result except for the last three lemmas.
If this is still hard to review I can split it arbitrarily in half.
Great work!
Great work!

```suggestion
- `Algebra.H1Cotangent.map`
- `Algebra.H1Cotangent.δ`
- `Algebra.H1Cotangent.δ`
```
I think these 5 maps should be `map`, `δ`, `mapBaseChange`, `map`, `map` respectively? And maybe the lemma `exact_δ_map` should be named `exact_δ_mapBaseChange`?
Is this needed because you can't provide a term directly?
The last time I checked, Lean gets confused and it times out horribly, but it seems fine now.
Are those needed to prevent timeouts? Is this another case of the general `map_{add,zero,one,mul}` lemmas having too bad of a simp key?

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
/--
Given `R[X] → S` and `S[Y] → T`, this is the lift of an element in `ker(S[Y] → T)`
to `ker(R[X][Y] → S[Y] → T)` constructed from `P.σ`.
-/
```
otherwise the "the" is confusing.

Also, this is the pre-image constructed in the definition of `Q.comp P` right? So maybe you could deduce this from the following lemma
```lean4
lemma mem_ker_comp_of_mem_ker (Q : Generators S T) (P : Generators R S) (x : T)
    (hx : Q.σ x ∈ Q.ker) : (Q.comp P).σ' x ∈ (Q.comp P).ker := sorry
```

I failed to deduce this from that lemma because `x` here lies in the polynomial ring.
In fact `(x : T) (hx : Q.σ x ∈ Q.ker)` should imply `x = 0`.

```suggestion
  refine ⟨x.1.sum fun n r ↦ ?_, ?_⟩
  · exact rename Sum.inr (P.σ r) * monomial (n.mapDomain Sum.inl) 1
```
I find this easier to parse.

Okay I now realize this breaks the proof of `ofComp_kerCompPreimage`. Do you understand why this happens? The terms should be the same, no? I guess this is the reason why we should be careful with tactics producing data, even with these seemingly harmless ones as `refine`.
This is intentional to control the elaboration order so that the term has type `(Q.comp P).Ring` and not `MvPolynomial (Q.vars ⊕ P.vars) R`
This should go to the `Generators` file I think.

```suggestion
induction' v₁ using Finsupp.induction with k n v _ _ IH
  · induction v₂ using Finsupp.induction
    · simp only [comp_vars, ← Prod.zero_eq_mk, map_zero, ofComp_val, Finsupp.prod_zero_index,
        mul_one, ← algebraMap_eq_smul_one, monomial_zero', algHom_C]
      exact Hom.toAlgHom_C _ _
    · have (i j) : e.symm (0, Finsupp.single i j) = Finsupp.single (Sum.inr i) j := by
        ext (i | j) <;>
          simp only [comp_vars, Finsupp.sumFinsuppAddEquivProdFinsupp_symm_apply, ne_eq,
            Finsupp.coe_sumElim, Finsupp.coe_zero, Sum.elim_inl, Pi.zero_apply, Sum.inr.injEq,
            not_false_eq_true, Finsupp.single_eq_of_ne, e, Sum.elim_inr, Finsupp.single_apply,
            reduceCtorEq, ↓reduceIte]
      simp only [← Prod.zero_mk_add_zero_mk, map_add, monomial_single_add, _root_.map_mul, map_pow,
        Hom.toAlgHom_X, ofComp_val, Sum.elim_inr, Function.comp_apply, monomial_zero', map_aeval,
        coe_eval₂Hom, eval₂_monomial, RingHom.coe_comp, aeval_X, *]
  · have (i j) : e.symm (Finsupp.single i j, 0) = Finsupp.single (Sum.inl i) j := by
```
If you agree, there are more occurrences below.

```suggestion
variable (Q : Generators S T) (P : Generators R S)

```
It seems to be this `lemma` that is very close to timing out. This means this lemma is unusable outside of this file without the manual `local instance`s at the top, right?
It "Used 42728 heartbeats, which is less than the current maximum of 200000." on my local machine though.

```suggestion
      rw [Finset.sum_filter, ← finsum_eq_sum_of_support_subset _ (this x)]
```

```suggestion
      simp only [ker, AddEquiv.toEquiv_eq_coe, RingHom.mem_ker, map_sum, algebraMap_apply]
```
Maybe `CotangentSpace.compEquiv`?

Could you add an explanation (maybe in the module docstring), that `Generators.H1Cotangent.δ` is obtained from the connecting hom of the snake lemma? Then you could explain that the exactness of the columns is by definition of `H1` and the exactness of the rows is shown in the first two sections of the file. Then finally in the third section, you show that `δ` does not depend on the choice of generators, so `H1Cotangent.δ` is defined to be `Generators.H1.Cotangent.δ` for the canonical generators.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory): Jacobi-Zariski sequence
